meanings.definition: Include or absorb (something) in something else
meanings.sent1: The recipe called for subsuming the spices into the sauce.
meanings.sent2: She subsumed all her worries into her work to stay focused.
meanings.sent3: The vacuum cleaner seemed to be subsuming everything in its path, including the cat's toy.
meanings.sent4: His passion for music subsumed his interest in other hobbies.
meanings.sent5: The darkness of the night subsumed the city, creating a peaceful atmosphere.

meanings.definition: To bring together or incorporate (parts) into a whole
meanings.sent1: The artist was subsuming various colors to create a beautiful painting.
meanings.sent2: The chef subsumed different flavors to make a unique dish.
meanings.sent3: The puzzle master enjoyed subsuming all the pieces into a complete picture.
meanings.sent4: Her leadership style subsumed the strengths of each team member to achieve success.
meanings.sent5: The architect subsumed different architectural styles to design a stunning building.
